intro: Epilobium nudicarpum, commonly known as narrow-leaved willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from June to August. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in damp meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges.
